channel.title: Hello, need help (Actually RSC)
channel.description: Hello, I am starting an RSC server, and want a bud to connect to me right now with Hamachi just to get things sorted out until we actually want to host the server on a no-ip. I have the server running and everything, just don't know how to get hamachi working. I have put my Hamachi IP into the client folder settings, but still I cannot connect. Does anyone have experience with RSC Hamachi connectivity?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 29, 2009, 07:31:33 pm[/size][hr]Oh I have also portforwarded 80 and 43594.

item.title: Hello, need help (Actually RSC)
item.dc:creator: @mrrules mrrules
item.description:
@mrrules wrote:

you can connect to your own server no matter what… Just use your lan ip… 127.0.0.1

item.title: Hello, need help (Actually RSC)
item.dc:creator: @Maskmanator Maskmanator
item.description:
@Maskmanator wrote:

My point is, I’m trying to get other people to connect. But I can’t connect to myself, does that mean others can’t? I think I’m getting it.

Read full topic

item.title: Hello, need help (Actually RSC)
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

[quote=“Maskmanator, post:7, topic:259215”]Yeah, but still doesn’t work. Anything I need to change in the Server files?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 30, 2009, 10:55:50 am[/size][hr]Buildfile: build.xml

runclient:
[java] java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out: connect
[java] java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out: connect
[java] java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out: connect
[java] java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out: connect
[java] java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out: connect
[java] java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out: connect

I get this everytime I try to login using my portforwarded IP.[/quote]

If you’re running the server off your computer and want to play it on that same computer then you’ll need two different clients. 1 with 127.0.0.1 (localhost) as the IP, and the other with your external IP (whatismyip.com). The client that connects to your external IP is for everyone else to use except you (unless you are trying to play from a different computer).

This is for non-hamachi, just regular portfowarding people.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @mrrules mrrules
item.description:
@mrrules wrote:

No hamachi is what you use if you don’t want to portfoward… People have to connect to your hamachi network order to connect with the hamachi IP.

item.title: Hello, need help (Actually RSC)
item.dc:creator: @mrrules mrrules
item.description:
@mrrules wrote:

With hamachi all you do is download it and open it up and then start your server up. You give the people the IP that is on the top part of hamachi, not your actually IP from like ipchicken.com or what ever.

Read full topic

item.title: Hello, need help (Actually RSC)
item.dc:creator: @Maskmanator Maskmanator
item.description:
@Maskmanator wrote:

Yeah, but no-ip never works, and even if I am portforwarded, I go to IPChicken.com, that is my external IP, right? I try to put that IP in my settings in the client settings, and it still does not work.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 29, 2009, 07:46:58 pm[/size][hr]Or if anyone could tell me atleast why no-ip never works for me, or why the IP never works for me, that would be great too :). +love!
